2008T501-d-05-20-08-BB.Narrative: Z62620 WAS SWITCHING CARS ON THE SOUTH END OF THE BANK TRACK.  THE YARD CREW HAD 36 CARS ON THE REAROF THE LOCOMOTIVE; THEY WENT INTO ONE OF THE INDUSTRIES TO PICK UP 4 CARS ON THE HEAD OF THE LOCOMOTIVE.  TO ACCOMPLISH THIS MOVE, THE CUT OF CARS HAD TO BE MOVED NORTH OF THE SWITCH TO THE INDUSTRY.THE NORTH END OF THE CUT WAS NEAR THE TURN OUT FROM THE BANK TRACK TO YARD #4 TRACK.  THE SAME CREW WORKED THE NIGHT BEFORE; THEY KNEW THAT THE SWITCH WAS LINED FOR MOVEMENT FROM THE BANK TRACK TO #4.  ON MAY 20TH, THE ENGINEER WAS PROVIDING THE CONDUCTOR WITH A TOUR OF THE YARD AND INDUSTRY TRACKS (AS THE CONDUCTOR IS A NEW HIRE TO THE RAILROAD).  DURING THIS TOUR, THE ENGINEER LOOKED TOWARD THE TURNOUT FROM THE BANK TRACK TO YARD #4 TRACK AND THOUGHT THE TARGET INDICATED THE SWITCH WAS LINEDFOR THE BANK TRACK TO #4 TRACK.  BEING THE ONLY JOB IN THE YARD, THE ENGINEER FELT THAT SWITCH SHOULD BE LINED FOR MOVEMENT FROM THE BANK TRACK.  WHEN THE 36 CAR CUT WAS TO BE SHOVED, THE CONDUCTOR STARTED TO WALK TO THE REAR OF THE CUT TO PROTECT THE MOVEMENT, BUT THE ENGINEER FELT THAT THIS WAS NOT NECESSARY.  WHEN THE CUT MOVED NORTH, THE REAR TWO CARS RAN THROUGH THE SWITCH (WHICH WAS LINED FOR MOVEMENT FROM #4 YARD TO #4 YARD TRACK.  THE CREW, AT THE OPPOSITE END OF THE CUT PROCEEDED TO MAKE TWO MORE MOVES, ONE SOUTH, (WHICH DERAILED THE CARS) AND ONE MORE NORTH.  AT THIS TIME THE ENGINEER FELT THAT THE MOVEMENT WAS MORE DIFFICULT TO MAKE; THEY INVESTIGATED AND FOUND THE TWO CARS DERAI

0805061-d-05-06-08-MMA.Narrative: METHOD OF CONTROL OCCUPATION CONTROL SYSTEM - JOB 300 WAS OPERATING NORTH AROUND MILE 165 WHEN THE LOCOMOTIVE ENGINEER NOTICED A REDUCTION IN AIR ON THE REAR CAR.  THE ENGINEER WAS OPERATING ABOUT 30MPH AND HAD NOT TAKEN A REDUCTION OF AIR IN THE TRAIN.  THE APPARENT LEAK WAS SLOWLY SETTING THE BRAKES AND EVENTUALLY BROUGHT THE AIR DOWN TO 70 POUNDS ON THE REAR WHILE MAINTAINING 88 POUNDS ON THEHEAD END.  THE TRAIN BEGAN SLOWING DOWN AND CAME TO A STOP AT MILE 165.54.  ON INSPECTION  THE 38TH,40TH, 47TH AND 48TH CAR WERE FOUND TO BE DERAILED UPRIGHT AND BASICALLY IN LINE WITH THE TRACK WHICH WAS PUSHED/PULLED INTO AN S TYPE CONFIGURATION.  THE CONDUCTOR DISCOVERED A SMALL LEAK IN THE TRAIN LINE HOSE OF CAR NUMBER 40 (MMA 5573).  THE LEAK WAS LOCATED IN THE HOSE THAT RUNS BETWEEN THE CARFRAME TRAIN LINE PIPING AND THE CONNECTOR LOCATION WITH THE OUTSIDE AIR HOSE THAT IS USED TO CONNECT WITH OTHER EQUIPMENT.  FURTHER INSPECTION SHOWED THAT THE AIR LINE HOLE WAS PROBABLY MADE WHEN SOME TYPE OF STEEL PLATING OF OTHER HEAVY STEEL ITEM WAS STRUCK BY THE TRAIN.  RECENT DAMAGE WAS ALSO NOTED NEAR THE HOSE LOCATION WHERE SOMETHING HAD STRUCK THE STEEL FRAME OF THE CAR WITH SIGNIFICANT FORCE TO CAUSE IMPACT DAMAGE TO THE STEEL (NO RUST NOTED).  THE HOLE IN THE TRAIN LINE BEGAN A CHAINREACTION SETTING CAR BRAKES OUTWARD FROM CAR NUMBER 40 IN BOTH DIRECTIONS. 001-d-05-10-08-BLR.Narrative: AFTER RECEIVING TRACK AND TIME FROM KCS DISPATCHER (KDH), BLR CREW PROCEEDED ON TO KCS MAIN TRACK ATCP 170, PROCEEDED TO HUNT YARD AT 10-15 MPH UPON ARRIVING AT THE DGNO CONNECTION.  THE ENGINEER FAILED TO SEE AN AUTOMATIC SWITCH LINED AGAINST THEIR MOVEMENT.  APPLIED EMERGENCY BRAKES BUT NOT IN TIME TO STOP BEFORE SPLITTING SWITCH APPROXIMATELY ONE CAR LENGTH .  THE BLR CREW WAS MOVING AT A SPEED THAT DID NOT ALLOW TIME TO STOP ONCE IT WAS OBSERVED THE AUTOMATIC SWITCH WAS LINED AGAINST THEM.THEREFORE, THEY WERE NOT TRAVELING AT RESTRICTED SPEED AS REQUIRED.  THE CREW WAS NOT NOTIFIED THATUPON ACCEPTING TRACK AND TIME THAT AUTOMATIC SWITCHES WERE NOT LINED FOR THEIR MOVEMENT.  IN THE PAST 100% OF THE TIME MAIN LINE SWITCHES HAVE ALWAYS BEEN IN NORMAL POSITION (LINED FOR THE MAIN TRACK).

I0508-d-05-01-08-PATH.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to properly secure hand brake on car(s) (railroad  employee)
I0508-d-05-01-08-PATH.Accident Cause: Failure to properly secure hand brake on car(s) (railroad  employee)
I0508-d-05-01-08-PATH.Narrative:
AT APPROXIMATELY 10:54PM, THE ENGINEER/SWITCHMAN STORED A 7 CAR CONSIST ON THE EAST END OF N (TAIL)TRACK AND FAILED TO SECURE THE HAND BRAKE.  THE AIR BREAKS LOST POWER AND THE TRAIN ROLLED BACK TOWARD THE PORTALS ON N TRACK FOR APPROXIMATELY 2,000 FEET.  THE TRAIN GAINED MOMENTUM ON THE DOWN SLOPEOF THE CURVED TRACK (THAT WAS OUT-OF-SERVICE, POWER REMOVED).  CAR 809 DERAILED AFTER PLUNGING THROUGH THE LOCKED FENCE AND COLLIDING WITH THE 71 E SWITCH PANEL THAT WAS BEING CONSTRUCTED, PUSHING ITBACK APPROXIMATELY 175 FEET ALONG WITH THE PEM-LEM TRACK LIFTING MACHINE AND TRUCK UNDERNEATH THE TRAIN.  SEVERAL OF THE TIES ON THE WOODEN PLATFORM MERGED TOGETHER AND CLOSED THE NORMAL 21-INCH GAP.STAFF FROM ALL CAR EQUIPMENT, TRANSPORTATION, POWER, SIGNALS & COMMUNICATIONS AND WAY & STRUCTURESRESPONDED TO THE SCENE.  CED REPORTED AT THE TIME THAT NO HANDBRAKES WERE APPLIED TO THE TRAIN. ONEOF THE 7-CAR CONSIST (809-175-888-654-648-833-656) DERAILED.   A 14-CAR TRAIN WAS PULLED UP TO THECONSIST TO PULL THE TRAIN ONTO THE RAILS. HOWEVER, AFTER SEVERAL UNSUCCESSFUL ATTEMPTS, THE RERAIL CAR WAS REQUESTED AT 1:25AM.  CAR 809 WAS RE-RAILED BY 3:33AM AND A 10MPH RESTRICTION WAS ACTIVATED AS THE CONSIST WAS TAKEN OUT-OF-SERVICE AND MOVED TO HARRISON YARD FOR A THOROUGH EVALUATION. A TOTALOF $30,000 IS ESTIMATED IN DAMAGES TO TRACK EQUIPMENT AND INFRASTRUCTURE.  NO INJURIES HAVE BEEN REPORTED.

THE ENGINEER WAS FOUND IN VIOLATION OF RULE #316 "WHENEVER A TRAIN IS LEFT STANDING UNATT

080046-d-05-01-08-WE.Primary Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
080046-d-05-01-08-WE.Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
080046-d-05-01-08-WE.Narrative: 708-01 PULLED INTO NORFOLK SOUTHERN CAMPBELL ROAD YARD WITH CONSIST AS FOLLOWS: ENGINE 107 ON HEAD END, 57 CARS THEN ENGINE 301 IN LEAD TRAIL ON THE REAR.  CREW PULLED INTO #29 TRACK AND CUT OFF 28 CARS PLUS LOCOMOTIVE WE 301. THEN SHOVED REMAINING 29 CARS AND THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE WE 107 INTO #28 TRACK.  THE CREW THEN CUT OFF THEIR LEAD LOCOMOTIVE WE 107 AND WENT LITE WITH LOCOMOTIVE DOWN # 27 TRACK IN ROUTE TO # 15 TRACK WHERE THE CREW WAS TO TIE THEIR LOCOMOTIVES DOWN FOR THE NIGHT. WHILE GOINGDOWN #27 TRACK THE CREW OBSERVED THE CARS AND LOCOMOTIVE WE 301 THAT THEY HAD PULLED INTO #29 TRACKHAD NOT CLEARED THE LEAD AT THE WEST END. AND FURTHER MORE THE 29 CARS THAT WERE SHOVED INTO #27 TRACK WERE SHOVED INTO THE TRACK WITHOUT PROPER PROTECTION FOR THE MOVEMENT. THIS RESULTED IN THE 29 CARS BEING SHOVED OUT THE WEST END OF #28 TRACK AND SIDE SWIPING ENGINE WE 301 RUPTURING THE FUEL TANK AS WELL AS DERAILING CAR CN 135358 WEST TRUCK. CONDUCTOR ADMITTED DURING INTERVIEW THAT HE FAILEDTO PROTECT SHOVING MOVEMENT INTO #28 TRACK.

080049-d-05-09-08-WE.Narrative: 536-09 CONDUCTOR SHOVED 34 CARS INTO FURNACE YARD #6, AT WHEELING PITTSBURGH STEEL. THE CONDUCTOR CUT OFF THE REAR 17 CARS IN FURNACE YARD #6, PULLED OUT WITH REMAINING 17 CARS, STARTED TO SHOVE 17 LOADS INTO THE DUMPER YARD. THE CARS THAT THE CONDUCTOR CUT OFF IN FURNACE YARD #6 WERE LEFT OUT TO FOUL DUMPER YARD TRACK #2. THE WE 502, WHICH WOULD HAVE BEEN THE 17TH CAR, STRUCK THE WE 619, WHICH WAS THE CAR LEFT TO FOUL DUMPER YARD TRACK #2, CAUSING WE 619 TO DERAIL.

080053-d-05-24-08-WE.Narrative: 536-24 WAS TRAVELING WESTBOUND AT MPH 78.5 WHEN THEIR TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY AND UPON INSPECTIONFOUND 5 CARS DERAILED, WPRR 15108, JOSX 7302, GATX 96324, UTLX 649608, AND CHVX 295035, DUE TO A BURNT JOURNAL ON WPRR 15108.  THE HAZMAT THAT WAS RELEASED WAS STYRENE MONOMER.  THERE WAS 1 GALLON LEAKED OUT OF EACH CAR.
